content: Known for her work on radioactivity, this Polish-born physicist was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.

Marie Curie is the answer you're looking for. She was a pioneering physicist and chemist who conducted groundbreaking research on radioactivity. Curie was not only the first woman to win a Nobel Prize but also the first person to win Nobel Prizes in two different scientific fields—physics and chemistry. Her contributions to science have had a lasting impact, and she continues to be an inspiration to many.
